claims.claim: The Flint water crisis contributed significantly to city dilapidation through increased vacancy.
claims.quote: So the water crisis contributed to the dilapidation too. So, because I'm renting, it's not mine, I'm not vested. [...] They left.

claims.claim: Residents leaving Flint due to the water crisis carried their grievances and societal issues to new communities.
claims.quote: They took that same, the same anger they had in them when they lived in Flint. They took it to this rural area. [...] They're the same people who were in the other city.

claims.claim: The relocation of Flint residents to rural areas led to misconceptions and fear among the rural population.
claims.quote: They saw these angry people, these people who are criminals. Oh my God, we're afraid of them.

claims.claim: Problems within a community do not cease simply because the demographics or geography of the community changes.
claims.quote: It don't stop because they changed the face of the community. It's still ingrained now.

claims.claim: Providing resources to individuals before they enter the criminal justice system can prevent the spread of societal issues.
claims.quote: So by not giving them the resources and trying to, before they go in jail, not trying to do that, what you did was create epidemic in a rural area that wasn't used to seeing that.

claims.claim: Changing the mindset of individuals is essential to resolving deep-rooted community problems.
claims.quote: So you have to change the mindset of the people, provide them with the resources that they need.
